repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
This PR adds options from `old_build_ext` to `new_build_ext`. Moreover, now `cython.Build.built_ext` points to `new_build_ext`.

Fixes #3541

comment_data.body: A question: Can we remove `pyrex-*` options in cython 3.0 (only from new_build_ext, they will be still present in old_build_ext)? Does it make sense?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -10,34 +11,158 @@
 else:
     from distutils.command.build_ext import build_ext as _build_ext
 
+try:
+    from __builtin__ import basestring
+except ImportError:
+    basestring = str
 
-class new_build_ext(_build_ext, object):
 
+class build_ext(_build_ext, object):
+
+    sep_by = _build_ext.sep_by
     user_options = _build_ext.user_options[:]
     boolean_options = _build_ext.boolean_options[:]
 
     user_options.extend([
+        ('cython-cplus', None,
+         "generate C++ source files"),
+        ('cython-create-listing', None,
+         "write errors to a listing file"),
+        ('cython-line-directives', None,
+         "emit source line directives"),
+        ('cython-include-dirs=', None,
+         "path to the Cython include files" + sep_by),
         ('cython-c-in-temp', None,
-             "put generated C files in temp directory"),
+         "put generated C files in temp directory"),
+        ('cython-gen-pxi', None,
+            "generate .pxi file for public declarations"),
+        ('cython-directives=', None,
+            "compiler directive overrides"),
+        ('cython-gdb', None,
+         "generate debug information for cygdb"),
+        ('cython-compile-time-env', None,
+            "cython compile time environment"),
+
+        # For backwards compatibility.

comment_data.body: Yes, I think that's the right time to do that.

comment_data.body: Is this needed? The thing is, if someone changes this in `build_ext`, then it won't be reflected here. It doesn't seem necessary to make a copy here. I'd rather keep things as generic and extensible as possible.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -10,34 +11,126 @@
 else:
     from distutils.command.build_ext import build_ext as _build_ext
 
+try:
+    from __builtin__ import basestring
+except ImportError:
+    basestring = str
 
-class new_build_ext(_build_ext, object):
 
+class build_ext(_build_ext, object):
+
+    sep_by = _build_ext.sep_by

comment_data.body:
I also wonder if we shouldn't get rid of this and always target specifically setuptools for 3.0 now – maybe if it's importable, to cover Py2.7 with a fallback to standard distutils.

The thing is, if users happen to import Cython's `build_ext` before setuptools, then they will end up with two different implementations.

See https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/4405 – probably not something to change right in this PR here, but it might have an impact on the implementation.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,5 @@
 import sys
+import os
 
 if 'setuptools' in sys.modules:

comment_data.body: I think we should generally call into `super(...)` here, rather than relying directly on the base class.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -10,34 +11,126 @@
 else:
     from distutils.command.build_ext import build_ext as _build_ext
 
+try:
+    from __builtin__ import basestring
+except ImportError:
+    basestring = str
 
-class new_build_ext(_build_ext, object):
 
+class build_ext(_build_ext, object):
+
+    sep_by = _build_ext.sep_by
     user_options = _build_ext.user_options[:]
     boolean_options = _build_ext.boolean_options[:]
 
     user_options.extend([
+        ('cython-cplus', None,
+             "generate C++ source files"),
+        ('cython-create-listing', None,
+             "write errors to a listing file"),
+        ('cython-line-directives', None,
+             "emit source line directives"),
+        ('cython-include-dirs=', None,
+             "path to the Cython include files" + sep_by),
         ('cython-c-in-temp', None,
              "put generated C files in temp directory"),
+        ('cython-gen-pxi', None,
+            "generate .pxi file for public declarations"),
+        ('cython-directives=', None,
+            "compiler directive overrides"),
+        ('cython-gdb', None,
+             "generate debug information for cygdb"),
+        ('cython-compile-time-env', None,
+            "cython compile time environment"),
         ])
 
     boolean_options.extend([
-        'cython-c-in-temp'
+        'cython-cplus', 'cython-create-listing', 'cython-line-directives',
+        'cython-c-in-temp', 'cython-gdb',
     ])
 
     def initialize_options(self):
         _build_ext.initialize_options(self)

comment_data.body: This construct occurs so often that it seems to merit a helper function, e.g. `get_extension_attr(options, extension, option_name, default=False)`, where `options` would probably just be the `build_ext` instance.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -10,34 +11,126 @@
 else:
     from distutils.command.build_ext import build_ext as _build_ext
 
+try:
+    from __builtin__ import basestring
+except ImportError:
+    basestring = str
 
-class new_build_ext(_build_ext, object):
 
+class build_ext(_build_ext, object):
+
+    sep_by = _build_ext.sep_by
     user_options = _build_ext.user_options[:]
     boolean_options = _build_ext.boolean_options[:]
 
     user_options.extend([
+        ('cython-cplus', None,
+             "generate C++ source files"),
+        ('cython-create-listing', None,
+             "write errors to a listing file"),
+        ('cython-line-directives', None,
+             "emit source line directives"),
+        ('cython-include-dirs=', None,
+             "path to the Cython include files" + sep_by),
         ('cython-c-in-temp', None,
              "put generated C files in temp directory"),
+        ('cython-gen-pxi', None,
+            "generate .pxi file for public declarations"),
+        ('cython-directives=', None,
+            "compiler directive overrides"),
+        ('cython-gdb', None,
+             "generate debug information for cygdb"),
+        ('cython-compile-time-env', None,
+            "cython compile time environment"),
         ])
 
     boolean_options.extend([
-        'cython-c-in-temp'
+        'cython-cplus', 'cython-create-listing', 'cython-line-directives',
+        'cython-c-in-temp', 'cython-gdb',
     ])
 
     def initialize_options(self):
         _build_ext.initialize_options(self)
+        self.cython_cplus = 0
+        self.cython_create_listing = 0
+        self.cython_line_directives = 0
+        self.cython_include_dirs = None
+        self.cython_directives = None
         self.cython_c_in_temp = 0
+        self.cython_gen_pxi = 0
+        self.cython_gdb = False
+        self.cython_compile_time_env = None
+
+    def finalize_options(self):
+        _build_ext.finalize_options(self)
+        if self.cython_include_dirs is None:
+            self.cython_include_dirs = []
+        elif isinstance(self.cython_include_dirs, basestring):
+            self.cython_include_dirs = \
+                self.cython_include_dirs.split(os.pathsep)
+        if self.cython_directives is None:
+            self.cython_directives = {}
 
     def build_extension(self, ext):
         from Cython.Build.Dependencies import cythonize
-        if self.cython_c_in_temp:
+
+        # Set up the include_path for the Cython compiler:
+        #    1.    Start with the command line option.
+        #    2.    Add in any (unique) paths from the extension
+        #        cython_include_dirs (if Cython.Distutils.extension is used).
+        #    3.    Add in any (unique) paths from the extension include_dirs
+        includes = list(self.cython_include_dirs)
+        try:
+            for i in ext.cython_include_dirs:
+                if i not in includes:
+                    includes.append(i)
+        except AttributeError:
+            pass
+
+        # In case extension.include_dirs is a generator, evaluate it and keep
+        # result
+        ext.include_dirs = list(ext.include_dirs)
+        for i in ext.include_dirs:
+            if i not in includes:
+                includes.append(i)
+
+        # Set up Cython compiler directives:
+        #    1. Start with the command line option.
+        #    2. Add in any (unique) entries from the extension
+        #         cython_directives (if Cython.Distutils.extension is used).
+        directives = dict(self.cython_directives)
+        if hasattr(ext, "cython_directives"):
+            directives.update(ext.cython_directives)
+
+        if self.cython_c_in_temp or getattr(ext, 'cython_c_in_temp', 0):
             build_dir = self.build_temp
         else:
             build_dir = None
-        new_ext = cythonize(ext,force=self.force, quiet=self.verbose == 0, build_dir=build_dir)[0]
+
+        if self.cython_cplus or getattr(ext, 'cython_cplus', 0):

comment_data.body: Here, I'd rather use `getattr(..., [])` than wrapping the whole loop implementation with a try-except.

+        includes = list(self.cython_include_dirs)
+        try:
+            for i in ext.cython_include_dirs:

comment_data.body: I have added `get_extension_attr(self, extension, option_name, default=False)` method. I hope now it is better.
comment_data.diff_hunk:

     user_options.extend([

         ('cython-c-in-temp', None,
              "put generated C files in temp directory"),
+        ('cython-gen-pxi', None,
+            "generate .pxi file for public declarations"),

         ])

-        'cython-c-in-temp'
+        'cython-cplus', 'cython-create-listing', 'cython-line-directives',
+        'cython-c-in-temp', 'cython-gdb',
     ])
 
     def initialize_options(self):
         _build_ext.initialize_options(self)
+        self.cython_cplus = 0
+        self.cython_create_listing = 0
+        self.cython_line_directives = 0
+        self.cython_include_dirs = None
+        self.cython_directives = None
         self.cython_c_in_temp = 0
+        self.cython_gen_pxi = 0
+        self.cython_gdb = False
+        self.cython_compile_time_env = None
+
+    def finalize_options(self):
+        _build_ext.finalize_options(self)
+        if self.cython_include_dirs is None:
+            self.cython_include_dirs = []
+        elif isinstance(self.cython_include_dirs, basestring):
+            self.cython_include_dirs = \
+                self.cython_include_dirs.split(os.pathsep)
+        if self.cython_directives is None:
+            self.cython_directives = {}
 
     def build_extension(self, ext):
         from Cython.Build.Dependencies import cythonize
-        if self.cython_c_in_temp:
+
+        # Set up the include_path for the Cython compiler:
+        #    1.    Start with the command line option.
+        #    2.    Add in any (unique) paths from the extension
+        #        cython_include_dirs (if Cython.Distutils.extension is used).
+        #    3.    Add in any (unique) paths from the extension include_dirs
+        includes = list(self.cython_include_dirs)
+        try:

+                if i not in includes:

+        except AttributeError:

+

+        ext.include_dirs = list(ext.include_dirs)
+        for i in ext.include_dirs:
+            if i not in includes:
+                includes.append(i)
+

+        #         cython_directives (if Cython.Distutils.extension is used).
+        directives = dict(self.cython_directives)
+        if hasattr(ext, "cython_directives"):
+            directives.update(ext.cython_directives)
+

             build_dir = self.build_temp
         else:
             build_dir = None
-        new_ext = cythonize(ext,force=self.force, quiet=self.verbose == 0, build_dir=build_dir)[0]
+
+        if self.cython_cplus or getattr(ext, 'cython_cplus', 0):

comment_data.body: It make sense. I did just stupid copy from old_build_ext so there is some parts of code to be improved.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,5 @@
 import sys
+import os
 
 if 'setuptools' in sys.modules:

comment_data.body:
I have implemented that but only point what puzzles me is following comment:
https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/210524ef3f2efc13ebe2f4846f5427c8ccfd7b4b/Cython/Distutils/build_ext.py#L7-L8

I am not sure how this module can be imported during importing of setuptools. I how we don't introduce any regression :-/
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,5 @@
 import sys
+import os
 
 if 'setuptools' in sys.modules:

comment_data.body:
To be honest I don't fully understand this:

> The thing is, if someone changes this in build_ext, then it won't be reflected here. 

But I have removed the copying static attributes of base class and just simply override them. I hope now it is better.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -10,34 +11,126 @@
 else:
     from distutils.command.build_ext import build_ext as _build_ext
 
+try:
+    from __builtin__ import basestring
+except ImportError:
+    basestring = str
 
-class new_build_ext(_build_ext, object):
 
+class build_ext(_build_ext, object):
+
+    sep_by = _build_ext.sep_by

comment_data.body:
OK removing this line is causing CI crash. I suppose it is due setuptools imports cython build_ext:

https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/blob/9f1822ee910df3df930a98ab99f66d18bb70659b/setuptools/command/build_ext.py#L16
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,5 @@
 import sys
+import os
 
 if 'setuptools' in sys.modules:

comment_data.body: Ok, but if setuptools is trying to make use of Cython, which then makes Cython use distutils instead, that's really going in the wrong direction. Not sure how we can work around that, but this isn't a good way.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -5,8 +5,8 @@
     try:
         from setuptools.command.build_ext import build_ext as _build_ext
     except ImportError:
-        # We may be in the process of importing setuptools, which tries
-        # to import this.
+        # Since Cython.Distutils.build_ext is being imported in setuptools,
+        # we may be in the process of importing setuptools.
         from distutils.command.build_ext import build_ext as _build_ext

comment_data.body:
Looking at what setuptools does:
https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/blob/9f1822ee910df3df930a98ab99f66d18bb70659b/setuptools/command/build_ext.py#L16
It actually uses the `build_ext` from distutils, unless there is one provided by Cython – which inherits from the one in distutils.

Meaning, this whole attempt to use something from setuptools is wrong. Cython shouldn't try to inherit from itself. We should always be using `build_ext` from distutils to inherit from, never the one from setuptools, so that setuptools can decide which of the two to choose.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -5,8 +5,8 @@
     try:
         from setuptools.command.build_ext import build_ext as _build_ext
     except ImportError:
-        # We may be in the process of importing setuptools, which tries
-        # to import this.
+        # Since Cython.Distutils.build_ext is being imported in setuptools,
+        # we may be in the process of importing setuptools.
         from distutils.command.build_ext import build_ext as _build_ext

comment_data.body: Yes it make sense.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -5,8 +5,8 @@
     try:
         from setuptools.command.build_ext import build_ext as _build_ext
     except ImportError:
-        # We may be in the process of importing setuptools, which tries
-        # to import this.
+        # Since Cython.Distutils.build_ext is being imported in setuptools,
+        # we may be in the process of importing setuptools.
         from distutils.command.build_ext import build_ext as _build_ext

commit.message: Added options from old_build_ext to new_build_ext
rename the import from new_build_ext to build_ext
Minor reformatting
Remove backwards compatibility options
Multiple fixes of parameters

rename i to include_dir

commit.message: Use super() instead of calling method of base class
Use getattr() instead of catching AttributeError
Add get_extension_attr helper method
Skip testing if setuptools is in sys.modules
Directly override class attributes of build_ext

Revert "Skip testing if setuptools is in sys.modules"

This reverts commit f7b0f7b971513dfdc7e4f6234f7d7e8c9f788fe1.
Improve comment about importing Cython.Distutils.build_ext in setuptools
Update documentation
Added tests
Add dirs to cython_include_dirs from --include-dirs parameter
Remove attempt to use "build_ext" from setuptools since that would imply an endlessly recursive import.

Remove attempt to use "build_ext" from setuptools since that would imply an endlessly recursive import.

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: Added options from old_build_ext to new_build_ext
